intro: Lithodraba mendocinensis, commonly known as the Mendocino lithodraba, is a rare flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is found in specific regions of Mendocino County. It has small, greenish-white flowers and is often overlooked due to its subtle appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
